title: Why Chinese Stocks’ Recent Gains May Not Last
text:
Chinese stocks have staged a strong recovery in recent weeks from the beating they took in early August when U.S.-China trade tensions escalated with another round of tariffs. But weak economic data out of China this week—amid little sign the country is ready to unleash broad-based stimulus—could limit further gains, especially as another tranche of tariffs is expected to go into effect Oct. 1.

The iShares MSCI China exchange-traded fund (ticker: MCHI) is up about 9% since its Aug. 5 low, about twice as much as the S&P...
description: Weak economic data out of China this week—amid little sign the country is ready to unleash broad-based stimulus—could limit further gains, especially with more tariffs is expected to go into effect Oct. 1.
